meanings.definition: To be filled with intense, often foolish, passion or admiration for someone or something.
meanings.sent1: She became infatuated with the new book series and couldn't stop reading.
meanings.sent2: He was infatuated with the idea of becoming a famous actor.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed infatuated with the laser pointer, chasing it around the room endlessly.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was infatuated with thoughts of traveling the world and exploring new cultures.
meanings.sent5: The young girl was infatuated with the idea of flying to the moon one day.

meanings.sent1: The infatuated teenager wrote love poems to his crush every day.
meanings.sent2: She was known as the infatuated girl who always had a new crush in school.
meanings.sent3: The infatuated fan waited in line for hours just to get a glimpse of their favorite celebrity.
meanings.sent4: He was the infatuated admirer who sent flowers to her every week.
meanings.sent5: The infatuated admirer's heart skipped a beat whenever their crush walked by.
